name: An Everyday High School Romance
description:
Play as simple teenage girl Mari (the name is interchangeable) in this text-based game where all choices matter, but not in a bad-end or good-end way.

In this game, you will be able to make many choices that affect the kind of dynamics you'll have with your three love interests. Will you have a sarcastic or teasing relationship? Playful and flirty? Or down-to-earth and chill? You decide. 

As mentioned previously, nothing you will choose will give you a bad ending. So there is no need to feel like you have to make a choice purely to be in the good graces of the love interest of your choosing, like many other romance games.

There will be four routes in total – one for each love interest and the last being a polyamorous route. In this game, you can romance two males and one female.

Developer: Reader Gamer

Price: Free-to-play with the option of donations & with future NSFW DLC (which will cost $3.99) where the time will set a year after the characters graduate high school

Release Frame: When the timing is right

Rating: Teen (Base Game), Mature (DLC)

Platforms: Windows and Android

GAME INFO/FEATURES:
  • The game will take place over an in-game month.
  • The branching paths will be selected when choosing a partner for a school project.
  • On the weekends, you can choose to go on dates with varying options/locations filled with fun and sweet moments. Plus opportunities to learn more background information about the love interest(s).
  • Limited graphics; There are only four drawings shown in the game, which are to, momentarily, illustrate the PC and the LIs. As said, this is a text-based game, so if some aren't fond of reading an equivalent of a book – this game isn't for you.
